brief_description: Immune profiles were performed retrospectively in highly sensitized kidney transplant candidates
brief_title: Immune Profiles to Predict Response to Desensitization Therapy in Highly HLA-Sensitized Kidney Transplant Candidates
description: Single-cell mass cytometry by time-of-flight (CyTOF) phenotyping, gene arrays, and phosphoepitope flow cytometry were performed in 20 highly sensitized kidney transplant candidates undergoing desensitization therapy.
hypothesis: Our hypothesis was that baseline differences in immune profiles could help identify candidates that respond to desensitization therapy.
objectives: Our objective was to determine if baseline differences in immune profiles could help identify candidates that respond to desensitization therapy.
official_title: Immune profiles in HLA-sensitized  candidates undergoing desensitization therapy

pubmed.title: Immune Profiles to Predict Response to Desensitization Therapy in Highly HLA-Sensitized Kidney Transplant Candidates.

program.program_name: Improving Kidney Transplant Outcomes By Using Novel B-cell Immune Profiling
program.contract_name: Improving Kidney Transplant Outcomes By Using Novel B-cell Immune Profiling

race.race: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
